Oakland just saw the biggest rise in share of stale home listings in the U.S.

The Oakland area in July saw the country’s biggest increase in share of homes sitting on the market unsold for more than a month, compared with the same time last year, new data shows. But that doesn’t mean Oakland’s market has suddenly gone ice cold, experts and local real estate agents say.
